accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility.subtitle: Version of October 9, 2025 — This page describes our accessibility commitments, current limitations and how to report an issue.

commitment.title: 1) Our commitment
commitment.text: We strive to make this application accessible to as many people as possible. We aim for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance level when reasonably possible. However, we acknowledge that the application is not guaranteed to be 100% accessible today.

implemented.title: 2) What is already implemented
items: Semantic HTML structure (titles, headings, lists).
Keyboard navigation for main elements (menus, forms).
Color contrasts tested for most components.
Alt attributes on informative images when provided.
Minimal ARIA semantics where needed (roles and labels).
Visible focus and basic focus management after major interactions.

limitations.title: 3) Known limitations
limitations.intro: Despite our efforts, we have identified (or estimate possible) the following limitations:
items: Complex visual components (graphics, canvas, animations) that may interfere with some screen readers or cause distractions.
Dynamic content loaded after interaction (modals, asynchronous content) that may require ARIA announcements and focus management improvements.
Complex forms where some labels or descriptions may be missing or insufficient.
Multimedia (video/audio) does not systematically have subtitles or complete transcripts.
Possible contrast issues on custom themes or with user content.
limitations.report: If you encounter a specific barrier, please report it — see the Report a Problem section below.

testing.title: 4) How we test
methods: Automatic audits (Lighthouse, axe-core) on main pages.
Manual keyboard tests and with popular screen readers (NVDA, VoiceOver) on critical flows.
Contrast checks and UI component reviews.
testing.conclusion: We keep test reports and prioritize fixes based on user impact and technical feasibility.

roadmap.title: 5) Improvement roadmap
items: Fix critical issues identified by axe-core and Lighthouse on creation and registration pages.
Add ARIA announcements and improve focus management for modals and dynamic content.
Transcribe/caption important video content.
Improve form accessibility (explicit labels, accessible errors).
Conduct user testing with people with disabilities for essential flows.

mitigation.title: 6) Mitigation measures and tips
mitigation.intro: While waiting for fixes, here are some tips to work around certain obstacles:
tips: Use tab navigation and browser search to quickly reach sections.
If an image or media lacks description, activate the browser's reader mode or request transcription via contact.
If a form doesn't focus on an error, go directly to required fields and use Ctrl/Cmd+F to find labels.

reporting.title: 7) Report a problem
reporting.intro: If you encounter an accessibility barrier, please provide us with the following information:
info: URL (or specific step) where the problem occurs.
Description of the problem and its impact.
Operating system, browser and screen reader (if known).

response.title: 8) Response commitment
response.text: We acknowledge receipt of reports within 5 business days and provide a response or action plan within 30 business days when possible. If your report requires urgent action (e.g., complete inability to use an essential flow), please indicate this clearly for prioritization.

technical.title: 9) Technical accessibility — concrete points for developers
points: Check DOM order to respect visual order.
Add explicit labels for all form controls.
Manage focus: set focus on open modals and restore it on close.
Use role, aria-label and aria-describedby only when necessary and correctly.
Provide text alternatives for all non-text content.
Avoid excessive animations or provide a way to reduce them (prefers-reduced-motion).

accessibility.disclaimer: This document is provided for informational purposes only and does not replace legal advice. It is only for the ESGI course project, all of this remains as an example and fictional.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.subtitle: Version of October 9, 2025 — This page describes the cookies and other trackers used by WatchListy, why we use them and how to manage your preferences.

definition.title: 1) What is a cookie?
definition.text: A cookie is a small text file stored by your browser. It can be used to make the site work, remember preferences or measure usage.

principles.title: 2) General principle adopted
items: Do not transfer data outside the European Union.
Do not enable third-party tracking cookies without explicit consent.
Allow users to control their preferences via a banner / preference panel.

items.name: Performance cookies
items.description: anonymized measurements to improve the app (enabled only with consent).

items.name: Functional / optional third-party cookies
items.description: e.g. sharing services or CMP (Axeptio) — enabled after consent.

items.title: Session (server cookie)
items.description: Purpose: maintain user session (login). Type: HttpOnly cookie recommended. Duration: session or defined server-side (e.g. 7 days).

items.title: CMP (e.g. Axeptio) — optional
items.description: Purpose: consent management. Duration: depends on provider. To be enabled only if used.

consent.title: 5) Consent and management
consent.text: On first visit, a banner allows you to accept/refuse non-essential cookies. Choices are saved (e.g. technical cookie or localStorage) and can be modified via the preference center.
consent.note: Technical note: do not inject third-party scripts (analytics, widgets) until the corresponding consent has been given.

browser.title: 6) How to disable cookies via the browser
browser.intro: You can configure your browser to refuse cookies. Here are the general paths (vary by version):
steps: Chrome: Settings → Privacy and security → Cookies.
Firefox: Options → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data.
Safari: Preferences → Privacy → Block all cookies.
Edge: Settings → Cookies and site permissions.

rights.title: 7) Your rights
rights.text: You can withdraw your consent, request access to or deletion of your data. To do this, use the
rights.email: or the email indicated in the Privacy Policy.
rights.authority: In France, the competent authority is the CNIL.

updates.title: 8) Page updates
updates.text: We may modify this page. The revision date at the top of the page will be updated accordingly.

purposes.title: 3) Purposes and Legal Bases
purposes.intro: We process your data for the following purposes:

items.legal: creation and management of your account (contract execution).
anonymized analytics and audience measurement (legitimate interest or consent for certain trackers).
respond to your requests via the contact form (contract execution / legitimate interest).
fraud prevention and account protection (legitimate interest).

cookies.title: 4) Cookies and Trackers
cookies.text: We use strictly necessary cookies for the session and, if you accept them, audience measurement cookies. You can manage your preferences via the preference center (or cookie banner).

recipients.title: 5) Data Recipients
recipients.intro: Your data may be shared with:
items: Technical providers (hosting, monitoring, email sending) under subcontracting agreements.
Competent authorities if required by law.
recipients.guarantees: We require our providers to provide security guarantees compliant with GDPR.

transfers.title: 6) Transfers Outside the European Union
transfers.text: If data is transferred outside the European Union, we ensure that an adequate level of protection is guaranteed (standard contractual clauses, adequacy decisions, or other GDPR-compliant safeguards).

items.duration: retained as long as the account exists or according to legal obligations.
retained in pseudonymized or aggregated form for a reasonable period for the stated purposes (e.g. 12-36 months depending on the type of log).

security.title: 8) Security
security.text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data (password encryption, restricted access, backups, incident monitoring). Despite this, no system is invulnerable: report any anomaly immediately.

rights.title: 9) Your Rights
rights.intro: In accordance with GDPR, you have the following rights:

items.name: Right of access

items.name: Right to erasure
items.description: request deletion of your data, subject to legal obligations.

items.name: Right to data portability
items.description: when processing is based on your consent or a contract.

items.name: Right to withdraw your consent
items.description: (where applicable) without affecting the lawfulness of previous processing.

contact.text: To exercise your rights, contact us:

rights.complaint: You can also file a complaint with the supervisory authority (in France: the CNIL).

feature3.title: Ratings and reviews
feature3.description: Rate your favorite movies, write reviews, and discover recommendations from our passionate community.

feature4.description: Create thematic lists (to watch, favorites, by genre) and organize your collection your way.

feature6.title: Recommendations
feature6.description: Get personalized suggestions based on your tastes and watch history.
